info.title: TextIt
info.description:
Easily create interactive SMS applications anywhere in the world.  At the core of TextIt lies our exclusive Flow engine. With Flows, anybody can set up or modify a complex SMS application without the need of a programmer or expensive consulting company.
Using a basic Android phone, you can launch your application instantly in any country while avoiding expensive set-up costs or external technical support.

get.description: Returns the incoming and outgoing calls for your organization, most recent first.

parameters.name: call_type
parameters.description: one of the following strings: (filterable: call_type) mt_call - Outgoing Call  mo_call - Incoming Call  mo_miss - Missed Incoming Call

parameters.name: created_on
parameters.description: when the call was received or sent (datetime) (filterable: before and after)

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: the duration of the call in seconds (int, 0 for missed calls)

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: the phone number of the caller or callee depending on the call_type (string) (filterable: phone)

parameters.name: relayer
parameters.description: which relayer received or placed this call (int) (filterable: relayer)

get.description: A GET returns the list of Android relayers for your organization, in the order of last activity date. Note that all status information for the device is as of the last time it was seen and can be null before the first sync.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: which country the sim card for this relayer is registered for (string, two letter country code) (filterable: country)

parameters.name: last_seen
parameters.description: the datetime when this relayer was last seen by TextIt (datetime) (filterable: before and after)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of this relayer (string)

parameters.name: network_type
parameters.description: the type of network the device is connected to as reported by Android (string)

parameters.name: pending_message_count
parameters.description: how many messages are assigned to this relayer but not yet sent (int)

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: the phone number for the relayer (string) (filterable: phone)

parameters.name: power_level
parameters.description: the power level of the device (int)

parameters.name: power_source
parameters.description: the source of power as reported by Android (string)

parameters.name: power_status
parameters.description: the power status, either STATUS_DISCHARGING or STATUS_CHARGING (string)

parameters.name: relayer
parameters.description: the id of the the relayer (long)

delete.description: A DELETE removes all matching relayers from your account. You can filter the list of relayers to remove using the same attributes as the list call above.

get.description: Returns the SMS activity for your organization, listing the most recent messages first.

parameters.name: created_on
parameters.description: the datetime when this sms was either received by the relayer or created by TextIt (datetime) (filterable: before and after)

parameters.name: delivered_on
parameters.description: for outgoing messages, the datetime when the relayer delivered the message (null if not yet sent or an incoming message) (datetime)

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: the direction of the SMS, either I for incoming messages or O for outgoing (string) (filterable: direction)

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: the phone number of the sender or receiver, depending on direction (string) (filterable: phone)

parameters.name: relayer
parameters.description: the id of the Android relayer that sent or received this message (int) (filterable: relayer)

parameters.name: sent_on
parameters.description: for outgoing messages, the datetime when the relayer sent the message (null if not yet sent or an incoming message) (datetime)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: the status of this message, a string one of: (filterable: status) Q - Message is queued awaiting to be sent S - Message has been sent by the relayer D - Message was delivered to the recipient H - Incoming message was handled by TextIt F - Message was not sent due to a failure

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: the text of the message received, not this is the logical view, this message may have been received as multiple text messages (string)
